results.title: Wall Street, CP-B37 Reel Six Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Charles Hackett, 392 Reel Three Vitaphone record
results.brief_description:
Reel three of a short film about tenor singer Charles Hackett.

Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Sea Life)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are five parts to the Sea Life slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: Spotlights: Bruna Papandrea
results.brief_description: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which released the adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers in 2021.
results.description: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which released the adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers in 2021. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.
description_for_label: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which released the adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers in 2021. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.
